bug.short_desc: SELinux is preventing gutenprint52+us from using the 'wake_alarm' capabilities.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: - Installed package 'system-config-printer' - Opened Printer Config program and clicked button to Add Printer - SELinux Alert Browser opened with warning: 'SELinux is preventing gutenprint52+us from using the 'wake_alarm' capabilities.' SELinux is preventing gutenprint52+us from using the 'wake_alarm' capabilities.
***** Plugin catchall (100. confidence) suggests **************************
If you believe that gutenprint52+us should have the wake_alarm capability by default. Then you should report this as a bug. You can generate a local policy module to allow this access. Do allow this access for now by executing: # ausearch -c 'gutenprint52+us' --raw | audit2allow -M my-gutenprint52us # semodule -X 300 -i my-gutenprint52us.pp
Additional Information: Source Context system_u:system_r:cupsd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 Target Context system_u:system_r:cupsd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 Target Objects Unknown [ capability2 ] Source gutenprint52+us Source Path gutenprint52+us Port <Unknown> Host (removed) Source RPM Packages Target RPM Packages Policy RPM selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.19.fc24.noarch Selinux Enabled True Policy Type targeted Enforcing Mode Enforcing Host Name (removed) Platform Linux (removed) 4.8.4-200.fc24.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Oct 25 13:06:04 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 Alert Count 4 First Seen 2016-10-30 13:33:55 EDT Last Seen 2016-10-30 13:33:56 EDT Local ID dcf77b21-7ffc-4a7f-a575-9c3960015244
Raw Audit Messages type=AVC msg=audit(1477848836.525:361): avc: denied { wake_alarm } for pid=6482 comm="hpfax" capability=35 scontext=system_u:system_r:cupsd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tcontext=system_u:system_r:cupsd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tclass=capability2 permissive=0
Hash: gutenprint52+us,cupsd_t,cupsd_t,capability2,wake_alarm
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.19.fc24.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.2 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.4-200.fc24.x86_64 type: libreport
Potential duplicate: bug 1385769
*** Bug 1385769 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Description of problem: I plugged in an HP Laserjet 1320n printer and SELinux reported this AVC denial.
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.19.fc24.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.2 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.4-200.fc24.x86_64 type: libreport

Description of problem: I get daily this error just after every new login but on this box only. It's not reproducible on another box, I assume a relation to specific configuration settings.
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.19.fc24.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.2 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.4-200.fc24.x86_64 type: libreport

Description of problem: Was printing a test page (ink cartridge cleaning).
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.2 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.4-200.fc24.x86_64 type: libreport

Description of problem: I tried to print an one-page text document from Libre Office Writer on HP LaserJet P1102.
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.19.fc24.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.2 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.4-200.fc24.x86_64 type: libreport

Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-220.fc25.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.8.0 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.6-300.fc25.x86_64 type: libreport
*** Bug 1393194 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.21.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-abb3ede5d5

Description of problem: Printer has been connected to the machine on usb port
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.19.fc24.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.2 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.4-200.fc24.x86_64 type: libreport

Description of problem: Connect printer+scanner
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.8.0 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.6-300.fc25.x86_64 type: libreport

- Removed printer from Print Settings. - Added printer to ensure the error message still appeared; received the error message; removed printer. - Downloaded selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.21.fc24 packages and performed upgrades; rebooted computer. - Opened Print Settings and added HP Deskjet 2540 printer; checked SELinux Troubleshooter; no error messages. - Test print successful; no SELinux errors. - Updates resolved this issue.
Thank you.

selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.21.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-abb3ede5d5

Description of problem: Turned on Samsung printer.
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.20.fc24.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.2 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.4-200.fc24.x86_64 type: libreport

(In reply to Fedora Update System from comment #12) > selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.21.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing > repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug > report. > See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for > instructions on how to install test updates. > You can provide feedback for this update here: > https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-abb3ede5d5
The error is gone on my system with this update applied.
*** Bug 1394838 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
